Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement from the technology and design sector - "come up here, we'll fix that." The Dutch hate the tech royalty who have gobbled up all the nice cities.
They have lost sight of the people.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area with spikes with feeding tubes going all over the place and into the crew member's bodies' mouths. So they come to a conclusion that the lost crew was murdered and vivisected, hence the name, the group was once abducted by some Alien Abductors with a demonic nature.

I saw it tonight and fell asleep in the movie.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie in a theater. I only have done it after torture at home. Trailer was lame The actual movie with approximately 20 minutes spent showing the actual trailer was disturbing, and NOT what I'd thought this movie was going to be about. kind of a downer wasn't what I'd expected.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to more recent Disney fairy tales, thanks to computer graphics. The biggest mistake to me is that the picture was duplicated and this made everyone's movements stiff and un-natural.
I'm not certain I enjoy the story with regards to the part where Griselda and Xavier fall in love

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have found safe haven in Fantasy Land. They live secure lives in emerald cities, under the protection of brilliant suns and silvery moons that are comprised mostly of the gold that was taken out of circulation. The Poor live a life affected by visible particles of dirt on the streets
